column1: # List of public mass shootings from the beginning of the federal assault weapons ban
# Inclusion in the data set requires that at least four people be killed in public

column2: and the incident was not associated with criminal activity or self-defense
we include some events that do not meet this criteria that have

column1: # been included in other past compilations of public mass shootings.  However
# flag such events in the meet_inclusion_criteria field.
# This dataset can be freely used and shared
column2: as long as the header information

column1: # remains intact and the source and author are properly cited.

column24: summary
column25: reason_excluded

column24: Killed 12 and wounded 1 in a nightclub
Killed 11 and wounded 6 in a synagogue
Ramos broke into a newsroom, killing 5 and wounding 2
Pagouritzis opened fire in a classroom at his high school, killing 10 and wounding 13
Perpetrator opened fire at a waffle house, killing four and injuring two.
The perpetrator, a recently expelled student, opened fire at a school, killing 17 and wounding 14 others.
The perpetrator opened fire at a carwash, killing his ex-girlfriend and three acquaintances in a vehicle and the parking lot.
The perpetrator opened fire at a church, killing 26 and injuring 20.
The perpetrator opened fire at a concert, killing 58, and wounding 422.
Perpetrator opened fire at his workplace, killing five co-workers.
Perpetrator opened fire at a the bank where his estranged wife worked, killing four.
Perpetrator opened fire after a super bowl party at a club, after a verbal altercation, killing four.
The perpetrator opened fire at the Fort Lauderdale airport, killing five and wounding six.
The perpetrator opened fire at a mall, killing five.
The perpetrator opened fire on police at a Black Lives Matter event, killing five and wounding 11.
The perpetrator opened fire at a nightclub, killing 49, and injuring 53.
The perpetrator, an Uber driver, shot at people between picking up clients, killing six and wounding two.
The perpetrators opened fire on co-workers at an office party, killing 14 and wounding 21.
The perpetrator opened fire on his writing class at the college, killing nine, and wounding nine more.
The perpetrator opened fire at a military recruiting center from the parking lot, wounding a marine. He then drove to US Navy reserve center, where he killed five and wounded one more.
Perpetrator opened fire at a church, killing nine and wounding one.
Perpetator opened fire at his school, killing five and wounding one.
Perpetrator opened fire at Cedarville Rancheria tribal offices and community center, kiling four and wounding two.
Perpetrator opened fire at the Washing DC Navy yard, killing 12 and wounding eight.
The perpetrator shot six people in neighboring towns, killing two in a barbershop and two at a car care business, before being killed by officers in a shootout after a nearly 19-hour standoff.
The perpetrator shot his mother dead at their home then drove to Sandy Hook Elementary school. He forced his way inside and opened fire, killing 20 children.
The perpetrator, upon learning he was being fired, went on a shooting rampage, killing the business owner, three fellow employees, and a UPS driver.
The perpetrator opened fire in a Sikh gurdwara, killing six and injuring three.
Perpetrator opened fire in a movie theater, killing 12 and wounding 58 others.
The perpetrator gunned down four people at a cafe and wounding another, and killed another person during a carjacking nearby.
The perpetrator, a former student at the college, opened fire in a nursing classroom, killing seven and injuring three.
Perpetrator entered a spa, shooting and killing four family members.
Perpetrator opened fire inside a hair salon where his ex-wife worked, killing eight and injuring one.
Perpetrator opened fire at an International House of Pancakes restaurant, killing four and injuring seven.
The perpetrator opened fire at a birthday party in a roller rink, killing five and wounding four.
Perpetrator opened fire in a supermarket parking lot where Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords was meeting with constituents, killing six and injuring 13.
Perpetrator opened fire at his work place, killing eight and injuring two.
Perpetrator opened fire at a restaurant, killing four and wounding three.
Perpetrator opened fire on police as a coffee shop, killing four.
Perpetrator opened fire at Fort Hood, killing 13 and injuring 32.
The perpetrator opened fire outside a store, killing four.
Perpetrator opened fire at a civic association center, killing 13 and injuring four.
Perpetrator opened fire at a nursing home where his estranged wife worked, killing eight and injuring two.
Perpetrator opened fire at his workplace, killing five and injuring one.
Perpetrator killed a family member, two co-workers, and a customer at a salvage yard.
Perpetrator opened fire in a lecture hall, killing five and injuring 17.
Perpetrator opened fire at a city council meeting, killing five and injuring two.
Perpetrator opened fire at the Youth with a Mission building, killing two and wounding two.  Later that day, opened fire at New Life Church, killing two more and wounding three.
Perpetrator opened fire at a mall, killing eight and injuring four.
Perpetrator opened fire at the university, killing 32 and injuring 17.  Also had killed two in a private dorm earlier.
Perpetrator opened fire at a shopping center, killing five and injuring four.
Perpetrator opened fire at a school house, killing five and injuring five more.
Perpetrator shot and killed four inlaws and wounded another in a church, then killed his wife in a parking lot.
Perpetrator opened fire at her workplace, killing seven co-workers. Had also killed a neighbor in their home earlier.
Perpetrator shot killed two people in front of a church after a verbal altercation, then drove away, shooting two more people.

Perpetrator murdered his grandfather, who was a police officer, and grandfathers girlfriend. Weise then drove his grandfathers squad car to Red Lake Senior High School and opened fire on the reservation campus, killing another seven people, and wounding five. Had also shot his grandfather and his companion in their home earlier.
Perpetrator opened fire at a meeting of his church congregation, killing seven and wounding four.
The perpetrator gunned down former Pantera guitarist Dimebag Darrell and three others at a concert, wounding seven more.
Perpetrator shot five co-workers at a meat packing plant, and wounded two others.
The perpetrator shot his ex-girlfriend and three other people in a bar after a verbal altercation.
The perpetrator shot and killed six co-workers at an auto parts warehouse.
The perpetrator opened fire at his Lockheed Martin workplace, killing six co-workers and wounding eight.
The perpetrator killed four co-workers and wounded two others at an aircraft parts manufacturing plant.
The perpetrator killed his girlfriend and four former co-workers in several locations, and wounded a police officer and a passing motorist. Also killed supervisor in his home.
The perpetrator opened fire at his former Navistar workplace, killing five and wounding four.
The perpetrator killed his wife at their store, then went to another market and killed three people who worked there.
The perpetrator opened fire on co-workers at Edgewater Technology, killing seven.
The perpetrator shot people at several locations including a store and a restaurant, killing four and wounding one. Also shot neighbor in their home earlier in the day.
The perpetrator gunned down four co-workers at the Radisson Bay Harbor Inn before killing a woman outside who refused to give him her car. Three others were wounded.
The perpetrator opened fire at his workplace, killing seven.
The perpetrator opened fire inside the Wedgwood Baptist Church during a prayer rally, killing seven and wounding seven more.

The perpetrator went on a shooting spree through two day-trading firms. He started at the All-Tech Investment Group, where he worked, then went on to Momentum Securities.  A total of nine were killed and 13 wounded.
The perpetrator opened fire at a supermarket, killing four and injuring one.
The perpetrators opened fire at their high school, killing 13, and injuring 21.
The perpetrator opened fire at an auto parts store, then walked down to a nearby school and continued shooting there.
The perpetrators ambushed students and teachers as they left school after one of the perpetrators pulled a fire alarm.  Five were killed and ten were wounded.
The perpetrator gunned down four bosses over a salary dispute.
A former Caltrans employee opened fire at a maintenance yard after he was fired for allegedly selling government materials hed stolen from work, killing four and injuring two others.
Perpetrator shot and killed four former business partners at their workplace.
The perpetrator opened fire at the R.E. Phelon Company in retaliation for being fired after an argument with a supervisor, killing four and injuring three.
A firefighter killed his wife at home, then went to his workplace and killed four co-workers and wounded three others.
The perpetrator opened fire on former co-workers inside their municipal trailer in an act of revenge after failing a drug test, killing five and injuring one.
The perpetrator opened fire at his workplace, killing four co-workers.
A disgruntled ex-employee opened fire at the Walter Rossler Company where he had worked, killing six.
